[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Consensus] [Error message non-determinism] Do error messages include non-deterministic information (timestamps, memory addresses) that could cause different error handling across validators? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Consensus] [Byte order dependencies] The use of to_le_bytes() and from_le_bytes() - are these guaranteed to produce identical results on big-endian vs little-endian systems? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Memory Safety] [Vector allocation DoS] Can an attacker provide AsmValue::Vector with millions of elements that cause excessive memory allocation during to_move_value() conversion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Memory Safety] [Stack overflow from recursion] The recursive to_move_value() and from_move_value() calls on vectors - what is the maximum nesting depth before stack overflow occurs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Memory Safety] [String allocation in Display] Can extremely large U256 values cause excessive memory allocation when converted to strings in the Display trait implementation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Memory Safety] [Clone/copy overhead] Are AsmValue instances efficiently cloned when passed to conversion functions, or can repeated conversions cause memory exhaustion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Error Handling] [Expect panic in production] Multiple expect() calls throughout the code - can any of these be triggered in production to cause assembler crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Error Handling] [Try_into unwrap] All try_into()? conversions propagate errors - but are there scenarios where the ? operator fails to catch conversion failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Error Handling] [Anyhow error context] Do anyhow errors provide sufficient context for debugging, or could vague error messages hide exploitation attempts? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Error Handling] [Partial conversion state] When vector conversions fail mid-way through collect(), is partial state properly cleaned up or can it cause memory leaks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Type-specific] [U8 truncation] When converting large AsmValue numbers to MoveValue::U8, can truncation occur silently if check_unsigned_number validation is bypassed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Type-specific] [U16 range issues] Are there edge cases where U16 range checks could be bypassed through careful manipulation of U256 bit patterns? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Type-specific] [U32 overflow] Can U32 constants be crafted that overflow when used in arithmetic operations in Move contracts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Type-specific] [U64 gas manipulation] Since gas is often represented as u64, can malformed U64 constants bypass gas metering checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Type-specific] [U128 financial attacks] For financial applications using u128 for token amounts, can precision loss during conversion lead to value manipulation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Type-specific] [I8 sign confusion] Can the signed I8 range (-128 to 127) be exploited to create unexpected negative values in Move contracts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Type-specific] [I16/I32/I64 arithmetic] Can signed integer constants interact with Move's arithmetic operations to cause integer overflow vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Type-specific] [I128 banking] For DeFi applications, can I128 signed values be used to represent negative balances that bypass security checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Advanced] [Multi-step conversion attack] Can an attacker chain multiple conversions (AsmValue -> MoveValue -> AsmValue -> MoveValue) to gradually shift values outside valid ranges through accumulated rounding errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Advanced] [Type downgrade attack] Can an attacker provide a U256 value that is valid, but when converted to a smaller type and back, changes meaning (e.g., U256 -> U8 -> U256 changes value)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Advanced] [Sign manipulation chain] Can alternating between signed() and unsigned() constructors be used to bypass security checks that rely on sign consistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Advanced] [Address aliasing] Can two different U256 values be crafted that convert to the same AccountAddress through u256_to_address(), enabling address collision attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Advanced] [Vector element smuggling] Can attackers hide malicious values inside vector elements that bypass top-level validation but cause exploits during element-wise processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Advanced] [Type hint manipulation] Can incorrect SignatureToken type hints to to_move_value() cause the assembler to generate bytecode with type mismatches that crash the VM? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-asm/src/value.rs] [Advanced] [Constant pool overflow] Can carefully crafted AsmValue constants be designed to overflow the Move bytecode constant pool size limits? (Medium)
